data.title: I used 'witchcraft' to make producer love me: Madonna
data.meta_description: Madonna has told a concert audience in Atlanta that she used witchcraft to make music producer Dallas Austin...
data.text:
Madonna has told how she was obsessed with a producer to the point of performing witchcraft. (AP PHOTO)

During her Celebration tour in Atlanta, Madonna has named the music producer she was enamoured with when she recorded her 1994 album Bedtime Stories.

Subscribe now for unlimited access .

In between songs, Madonna, 65, gave the audience a peek into her past romances. The singer claimed she was "madly in love with him" despite him treating her like "s***." One fan posted a video of the confession to X, captioned, "Madonna spilling hot tea."

"I'm just saying, you did, you dogged me, bro," Madonna said. "It's ok, I understand. You were just a boy. But I hope you've grown up by now.

"I am publicly shaming you. Did I say your name yet? His name is Dallas Austin."

At the time, Madonna was 35, and Austin was 23. Austin is known for producing hit songs such as The Boy is Mine by Brandy and Monica and Creep by TLC.

Madonna also told how obsessed she was with Austin to the point of performing witchcraft.

"I am telling you, I was so in love with him that I had this house in Miami, and I studied with this Santeria. She did all kinds of spells on (Austin) to make (him) fall in love with me."

The pop superstar said none of the spells worked but recording Bedtime Stories was a "magical experience."

Australian Associated Press
